intro: Wahlenbergia undulata var. latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal wahlenbergia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its beauty and resilience.
